targetExampleSentences: Si pones más peso, se romperá.
nativeExampleSentences: Where do you put the keys?
If you add more weight, it will break.

targetExampleSentences: Su renuncia me pone en una situación difícil.
nativeExampleSentences: His resignation puts me in a difficult position.

targetExampleSentences: Después de bañar a la bebé, hay que ponerle ropa limpia.
nativeExampleSentences: After giving the baby a bath, you have to put some clean clothes on her.

targetExampleSentences: Es lógico que pongan allí un colegio nuevo.
nativeExampleSentences: It makes sense to put a new school there.

targetExampleSentences: El mensaje que le puso era simple.
nativeExampleSentences: The message he sent her was simple.

targetExampleSentences: Mi profesor me puso mala nota.
nativeExampleSentences: My professor gave me a bad grade.

targetExampleSentences: Las gallinas ponen un huevo al día.
nativeExampleSentences: Hens lay one egg a day.

targetExampleSentences: Podemos alquilar ese sitio si todos ponemos algo de dinero.
nativeExampleSentences: We can rent the place if everybody puts in some cash.

targetExampleSentences: Pon la televisión para ver las noticias.
nativeExampleSentences: Put the television on to watch the news.
Shall we turn the heating on?

targetExampleSentences: Si tengo un niño le pondré Manuel, que es el nombre de mi padre.
¿Qué nombre le van a poner a la niña? - Todavía no lo sabemos.
nativeExampleSentences: If I have a boy, I'll call him Manuel, which is my father's name.
What name are you going to give your baby? - We don't know yet.

targetExampleSentences: Sandy y su esposo van a poner una panadería en la calle principal.
nativeExampleSentences: Sandy and her husband are going to open a bakery on main street.
